data.text: Do whatever it takes but keep the receipts. #FiscalMonitor @imf_podcast https://t.co/3kN5Gmkr1L #COVID19

Missed the press briefing on the #AsiaPacific region during the virtual #IMFMeetings?

Watch it here: https://t.co/d0qAPgDeqL https://t.co/017ExsQZXo
REPLAY: IMF Western Hemisphere Department Press Briefing https://t.co/vb5gL0VfEL

The latest Global Financial Stability Report shows that the financial system has already felt a dramatic impact during the #COVID19 crisis, and a further intensification could affect global financial stability. https://t.co/LvJ6Y10m3a #GFSR https://t.co/VU6ZprYSos
LIVE NOW: Press Conference by Alejandro Werner, Director of the IMF's Western Hemisphere Department. #Latam #Caribe #IMFAmericas https://t.co/T9qmfsnCr7

The IMF’s Executive Board has approved US$515 million to help #Panama respond to the economic impact of the #COVID-19 pandemic. The timely resources will help the country increase health spending and support the most vulnerable. https://t.co/LAP4QzEK9S https://t.co/Bb9RvhptVx
Economic policy in Latin America and the Caribbean in the time of #COVID-19 https://t.co/l6r7Oaorud https://t.co/tPxTHOCTLV

The informal economy suffers the most in crises. Given the high level of informality in many Latin American economies, how can countries reach and assist this segment of workers and other smaller businesses to provide social assistance during the pandemic https://t.co/Mhifxhv37g https://t.co/i6xgWqwUU5

Watch IMF African Department Director Abebe Selassie's SABC interview on the economic outlook for sub-Saharan #Africa and South Africa; IMF's role in fighting #COVID19; and IMF’s rapid-financing zero-interest loans. @SABCPortal https://t.co/GnhbVDolsk

IMF's Western Hemisphere Department Director, Alejandro Werner, describes the Fund’s actions to help countries in Latin America and the Caribbean fight the consequences of the Corona virus. #IMFamericas #COVID19 #IMFmeetings https://t.co/8qwXlJJIUz
What economic measures are #Latam and Caribbean countries taking to actively respond to the COVID-19 pandemic? Our latest #IMFblog explains https://t.co/2JRXKCRUk2 https://t.co/NIOd3VtrYi

Alejandro Werner, Director of the IMF's Western Hemisphere Department, tells us about the policy response by the governments of Latin America and the Caribbean to tackle the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/KcJ9EelAE0
Growth in Latin America is projected to contract by 5.2 percent this year—where economic activity has nearly plummeted amid the #COVID-19 crisis https://t.co/UlXOmdzkY9 https://t.co/CajU0oY6N2
STARTING NOW: Press Conference by Alejandro Werner, Director of the IMF's Western Hemisphere Department. Latam #Caribe #IMFAmericas https://t.co/GXugF1nZQ3

After a virtual meeting with the IMFC this morning, @KGeorgieva shared how touched she was by the support expressed by the IMF membership to help countries deal with the #COVID19 crisis. “We are in this together!” she stressed. #IMFMeetings  https://t.co/6rn5uChpyS https://t.co/2IE8QkjuJ5

LIVE NOW: Press briefing by IMF Managing Director @KGeorgieva and IMFC Chair @KganyagoLesetja on the discussions by the International Monetary and Financial Committee. #IMFMeetings https://t.co/lx78W5fx5T

The International Monetary and Financial Committee met this morning at the #IMFMeetings to discuss how to best support member countries during the #COVID19 health and economic crisis. Read their communique: https://t.co/vwqxzlOAUc

STARTING SOON: Press briefing by IMF Managing Director @KGeorgieva and IMFC Chair @KganyagoLesetja on the discussions by the International Monetary and Financial Committee. #IMFMeetings https://t.co/MKI7lPtInd

Join us today at 10:00am EDT for a press briefing by IMF Managing Director @KGeorgieva and IMFC Chair @KganyagoLesetja on the discussions by the International Monetary and Financial Committee. #IMFMeetings https://t.co/1VijPd1CBz https://t.co/VxVEonbEDf

In fighting #COVID19, cooperation among the #G20 is not only important for human solidarity, but also for preventing the resurgence of disease while limiting economic damage. Read the #G20 Note. https://t.co/QEZeO1ejDZ https://t.co/cXVFb4JRCh

The #G20 can help emerging and developing economies fight #COVID19 by sharing medical information and supplies, and by ensuring financing is available to combat the epidemic and save lives. Read the #G20 Note. https://t.co/LvmJTAp7FJ https://t.co/f6ipkIZNdi

Jihad Azour: In fact, the fund has moved in four tracks to help countries in #MENA and #CentralAsia address the current challenges, Watch the video and read the report https://t.co/gcdPtZOkWv #IMFMeetings https://t.co/yVwC0cY5B0
Economic growth in #Asia is expected to stall at 0% in 2020—the worst growth performance in almost 60 years. https://t.co/Nr3tD5nnGb #IMFBlog #IMFmeetings https://t.co/pfO1oQrHUp

Download the latest Regional Economic Outlook for Sub-Saharan #Africa (in English, Chinese, French, Portuguese and Spanish) here: https://t.co/S4tJuc6LyT #IMFAfrica #IMFmeetings https://t.co/mrw14Nk5SF

In emerging market economies and low-income countries, the #COVID19 pandemic is destabilizing, and enduring. Full and timely value-added tax refunds can grant businesses access to much-needed cash. More in the #FiscalMonitor https://t.co/4yV6zroLRJ https://t.co/4qjAKpmXAR

Jihad Azour: In GCC countries, non-oil growth is projected to drop by 4.3 percent, and deficits in national budget to exceed 10% of GDP in 2020. https://t.co/gcdPtZOkWv #IMFMeetings https://t.co/xukfVLXGNZ

The latest Regional Economic Outlook for Sub-Saharan #Africa discusses policies needed to limit the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic and prepare economies for recovery. Download the report here: https://t.co/S4tJuc6LyT #IMFAfrica #IMFmeetings https://t.co/IqPcfXnr7i

IMF’s Gaspar on fiscal policies to support people during the #COVID19 pandemic: Government debt and deficits will temporarily rise as countries spend to contain #COVID19. More in our #IMFblog https://t.co/G7iQ5CSZq6 #FiscalMonitor https://t.co/nvZyy8aO2R
How are we supporting our member countries during the #COVID19 pandemic? Learn more about the IMF's work to address this global challenge: https://t.co/ahowlEjAOF https://t.co/YvUPmeXscU

European countries are responding in innovative and unfamiliar ways, and they can learn from each other. To assist them, we have established a #COVID19 policy tracker that provides info on how countries are tackling the practical problems they encounter. https://t.co/FNvlZh8o7I https://t.co/7YCjgNbnKQ

Earlier today, we launched the April 2020 #FiscalMonitor. IMF’s Gaspar stressed that governments should do whatever it takes but make sure to keep the receipts. More in the #FiscalMonitor https://t.co/4yV6zroLRJ https://t.co/n1SVHUsrno

Coronavirus containment measures are severely affecting economies. Targeted support to hardest-hit households and firms is needed. This is a real economic shock and requires protecting people, jobs, and industries directly. https://t.co/Nr3tD5nnGb #IMFBlog #COVID19 https://t.co/eKxJD5CGOd
Economic growth in #Asia is expected to stall at 0% in 2020—the worst growth performance in almost 60 years. https://t.co/Nr3tD5nnGb #IMFBlog #IMFmeetings https://t.co/yLYZISwuzJ

Join us at 8:00 PM EDT (8:00 AM SGT) for a live press briefing by the IMF's Asia and Pacific Department. #IMFmeetings https://t.co/75OnLaccLp

IMF's @KGeorgieva speaking about policy choices in the pandemic with Imperial College's @neil_ferguson and @azraghani : 'Countries shouldn't have to choose between saving lives and livelihoods.' 
https://t.co/FJzfr035NW https://t.co/q0jAC1014t

Social distancing to slow the #coronavirus spread inevitably carries economic costs. Advanced economies, can draw on their strong tax-benefit systems. Read the details in our #FiscalMonitor https://t.co/4yV6zroLRJ https://t.co/fVVZ2XKkBM
IMF Executive Board today approved US$21.3 million disbursement to help The #Gambia address the economic impact of #COVID19. https://t.co/T0Urvnrp2s #IMFAfrica https://t.co/AMZqUM6kF0

.@KGeorgieva: What is the role of the IMF in helping countries face the economic impact of the #COVID19 pandemic? These are the priorities that we are highlighting in the Global Policy Agenda. https://t.co/w7FHuOw8df #IMFmeetings https://t.co/OzVXj2aeKg

LIVE NOW: IMF Managing @KGeorgieva speaks with Imperial College’s @neil_ferguson and @azraghani about the path of the #COVID19 pandemic and where we want the health community and the global economy to be in 6 months from now.  #IMFmeetings https://t.co/rIuDNRqmk0

IMF Managing Director @KGeorgieva’s Global Policy Agenda, Exceptional Times, Exceptional Action, highlights three priorities for policymakers around the world: protect lives, protect livelihoods, and plan for the recovery. https://t.co/K76DYZj4dD #IMFmeetings https://t.co/IsQ0N5JfYE

.@KGeorgieva: Exceptional times require exceptional action. Here I highlight the key priorities for policymakers to save lives and livelihoods. #IMFMeetings https://t.co/rFsys3Fjnj https://t.co/EQ5wv5ALzV

IMF MD @KGeorgieva speaks with Imperial College’s @neil_ferguson and @azraghani about the path of the Covid-19 pandemic and where we want the health community and the global economy to be in six months from now. Watch at 2:00 p.m. EDT on https://t.co/rIuDNRqmk0

"Exceptional Times—Exceptional Action"

IMF’s Selassie: Development partners should help address the sizable financing needs including through debt relief for the most vulnerable countries.  https://t.co/JwsarZM0sx  #IMFAfrica
#COVID19: An Unprecedented Threat to Development in Africa. https://t.co/0vuOdCRoFH #IMFAfrica

To save lives, governments should finance additional health and emergency services as much as needed. The IMF stands ready to deploy its $1 trillion lending capacity to assist member countries, with a focus on low-income developing countries. 
https://t.co/4yV6zroLRJ https://t.co/fNa4D5Ibu5
Download the latest Regional Economic Outlook for Sub-Saharan #Africa here: https://t.co/JwsarZM0sx #IMFAfrica

The new #FiscalMonitor released as the pandemic unfolds says countries need to do whatever it takes and keep the receipts, because what governments do now will determine the speed and strength of the eventual recovery.  
https://t.co/WxeI2Mcpvy https://t.co/XvblAJc6Eo

To save lives and protect people & firms, governments have announced about $8 trillion to fight the pandemic. #G20 countries are at the forefront. You can read the details in our #IMFBlog #FiscalMonitor
https://t.co/V7GQccw7DW https://t.co/apI6yTkjUG

In times of pandemic, fiscal policy is key to save lives and protect people. Governments have to do whatever it takes. But they must make sure to keep the receipts. More in our #FiscalMonitor 
https://t.co/4yV6zroLRJ https://t.co/cGwlqN9ppA

Jihad Azour: countries in #MENA & #CentralAsia should continue their swift efforts to save lives, contain the spread of #COVID19 and support hard-hit households and sectors https://t.co/gcdPtZOkWv #IMFMeetings https://t.co/1KlInkVlPq

Jihad Azour: Economies in #CentralAsia are projected to shrink 1% in 2020 as trade, tourism, and remittances drop in wake of #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/gcdPtZOkWv #IMFMeetings https://t.co/T3w0aQIYB7

Jihad Azour: #MENA’S oil-importers economies to contract by 1%, with remittances & investment drying up as global financial conditions tighten.  Already high public debt in many countries are expected to increase further.  https://t.co/gcdPtZOkWv #IMFMeetings https://t.co/CG6w9hSYEf

Jihad Azour: Growth in oil-exporting countries in #MENA is expected to decrease by 4.2% as they are hit with a double whammy —the global and domestic shutdown and lower oil prices. https://t.co/gcdPtZOkWv #IMFMeetings https://t.co/F2qBSnrgzJ

#MENA & #CentralAsia economies to shrink by an average of -2.8%, equal to removing $425 billion from the region’s total output due to dual shock: #COVID19 with devastating human & economic toll and the plunge in oil prices. Read latest economic outlook https://t.co/uB6sTYo15C

Jihad Azour: The humanitarian and refugee challenges in fragile and conflict-affected countries in #MENA and #CentralAsia are expected to be exacerbated by the economic crisis https://t.co/gcdPtZOkWv #IMFMeetings https://t.co/7xPhAk0inN

Join us now for a virtual live conversation on the Regional Economic Outlook Update for #MiddleEast, #NorthAfrica, #Caucasus and #CentralAsia with Jihad Azour. https://t.co/gcdPtZwJxV #IMFMeetings https://t.co/HJTHfZqYIr

IMF Thomsen: We fully support #Europe’s strong policy response. It is above all about saving lives and livelihoods. The broad support to workers and firms is also welcome, because it will help facilitate an early recovery. #IMFmeetings https://t.co/HHKw0sW9Kx

IMF’s Thomsen: The policy response to this crisis has been unprecedented, both in scale and swiftness. Governments have appropriately deployed the whole policy arsenal in the fight against the #COVID19 pandemic. More information on the #IMFblog
https://t.co/Fv37CscP1l https://t.co/DMBDLLxSMN

How will #COVID19 affect the growth in sub-Saharan Africa in 2020? Join us on Wednesday, April 15 at 7:30 AM EDT (11:30 AM UTC) for a press briefing on the economic outlook and how the IMF is supporting African countries. Watch here. https://t.co/7ahrJYErtz #IMFAfrica

Assuming the pandemic fades in the second half of 2020 and that policy actions taken around the world are effective, we project global growth in 2021 to rebound to 5.8% but it would be only partial. Read the latest #WEO https://t.co/93xXDRsg3B https://t.co/OALih0reUO

IMF Executive Board today approved US$114.49 million disbursement to help #Niger address the economic impact of #COVID19. https://t.co/iiLuy4a8U6 #IMFAfrica https://t.co/yBXqvxnfaJ
Sign up for the special virtual Spring Meetings newsletter and from now till April 17, we will send you a daily email with the schedule, reports released, blogs and videos. https://t.co/hGMM4mdbiT

Taming this pandemic requires strong multilateral cooperation: avoiding trade restrictions (particularly on medicines & essentials), and helping financially constrained countries with giving access to concessionary financing, grants, and debt relief. https://t.co/93xXDRsg3B #WEO https://t.co/EfWEewjf4U
Countries need to work together to slow the spread of #COVID19 and to develop a vaccine and effective therapies to counter the disease.

Today, the IMF Executive Board approved US$389 million disbursement to help El Salvador meet the urgent financing needs stemming from the #COVID19 pandemic. This represents the first IMF lending disbursement to the country in over three decades. https://t.co/wUWK3mZNZ5 https://t.co/6ZfsaezxpQ
IMF Executive Board today approved US$115.3 million disbursement to help Burkina Faso address the economic impact of #COVID19. https://t.co/4UtCoEyx33 #IMFAfrica https://t.co/sC3f0WSg75

Join us tomorrow, Wednesday, April 15 at 7:30 AM EDT (11:30 AM UTC) for a LIVE press briefing with Abebe Aemro Selassie, Director of the African Department, on the economic outlook for sub-Saharan Africa. https://t.co/S4tJuc6LyT #IMFAfrica #IMFmeetings https://t.co/EYV4YYPwDN

This rebound assumes the pandemic fades in the second half of 2020, and that policy actions taken by countries are effective in preventing widespread firm bankruptcies, extended job losses, and system-wide financial strains. #WEO https://t.co/93xXDRsg3B https://t.co/B2O27tfsvJ
Global growth is expected to partially rebound to 5.8% in 2021, well above trend, reflecting the normalization of activity from very low levels.

How does the global contraction in this recession compare to that of the Great Depression? And what will happen to debt levels over time? @GitaGopinath answers during the release of the April World Economic Outlook #WEO https://t.co/93xXDRsg3B https://t.co/WyNTcLYtMb
Central banks will remain crucial to safeguarding the stability of global financial markets and maintaining the flow of credit to the economy. https://t.co/PVq2D2HErM #GFSR #IMFBlog

In line with the scale and speed of the crisis, domestic and international policy responses need to be large, rapidly deployed, and speedily recalibrated as new data becomes available – said @GitaGopinath in her latest #IMFblog. #WEO https://t.co/5rJQbhTmkm https://t.co/1W6iMPCven

The contraction in advanced economies—where several countries are experiencing widespread outbreaks and deploying containment measures—is projected at -6.1% in 2020. Most economies in the group are in recession this year. Read more in the #WEO https://t.co/93xXDRsg3B https://t.co/JP0Sz1lmzI

For the first time since the Great Depression, both advanced economies and emerging market and developing economies are in recession: growth in AEs is projected at -6.1% and EMDEs -1.0%. For more details, read the #IMFBlog on the #WEO https://t.co/5rJQbhTmkm https://t.co/ZrdrP4n6uY
Emerging markets have experienced the sharpest portfolio outflows on record - about $100 billion https://t.co/sdoW7VOBXI #GFSR #IMFBlog https://t.co/sI7aIX57LN

Since the #COVID19 outbreak, prices of risk assets have fallen sharply: At the worst point of the recent selloff, risk assets suffered half or more of the declines they experienced in 2008 and 2009. https://t.co/WZ5VYMqcSh #GFSR #IMFMeetings https://t.co/ToGqYFHcTq

The latest Global Financial Stability Report shows that the financial system has already felt a dramatic impact during the #COVID19 crisis. A further intensification could affect global financial stability. https://t.co/AUne3uL4Cs #GFSR #IMFmeetings https://t.co/9BnByrBAVj
STARTING NOW: Live press conference on the release of the April 2020 Global Financial Stability Report by Tobias Adrian https://t.co/83NeCNklbc #GFSR #IMFmeetings https://t.co/rDkS6kksAb

Emerging market and developing economies are projected to contract by -1.0% in 2020 – a markdown of 5.4 percentage points relative to the January #WEO projections – reflecting large anticipated disruptions to activity from #COVID19. https://t.co/93xXDRsg3B https://t.co/wThflH3eUb
